intro: Mallotus pleiogynus, commonly known as the many-female mallot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
